C.text: Your fingernails deal a vicious wound.

D.text: A little elbow before you lose your grip.

E.text: You grip strand of foe’s hair. It breaks.

A.text: Grab foe’s arm. Oops. Try again.

C.text: Foe grabs, misses. You have initiative.

D.text: This was not a special moment.

A.text: You impede foe’s combat stance. You have the initiative.

B.text: Foe collides with your attack before you get a grip. Small bruise.

C.text: You cannot get a good grip, foe hurts himself evading. You have initiative.

D.text: Grab foe's head. If foe has helm, you twist it. Otherwise, you gain initiative.

E.text: Lame attack, but foe is concerned. He moves back.

A.text: Foe breaks free of a weak grip. You have the initiative next round.

B.text: Grab foe and give him a weak punch. He thinks you are dangerous.

C.text: Foe recovers, continues his defense by sweeping his weapon at your feet.

D.text: Push foe, unbalancing him. You have initiative for 2 rounds.

E.text: Strong passing blow near foe's head. His violent evasion is not productive.

A.text: Almost get a grip on foe's arm. He avoids his mistake. You gain the initiative next round.

B.text: You grip foe's shield arm. Foe's strike toward your head makes you let go of him. He keeps a distance.

C.text: Collide with foe. You push him away and he stumbles back 5 feet. It went better than you could have hoped.

D.text: Hard, but poorly placed. Foe bounces back out of your grip. He looks like he does not recognize you.

E.text: Uncoordinated attack and a little luck, allows foe to escape your grasp. You have initiative for 2 rounds.

A.text: Grip to lower back. Foe wards off your attack and prepares for your next move.

B.text: Grip fails, but bash does not. You unbalance your foe. You have the initiative.

C.text: Your attack is almost comical as you seek any little grip you can get. All the tiny tugs finally have an effect on foe.

D.text: Strike to foe's shield arm. If foe has no shield, you immobilize arm for 6 rounds.

E.text: Attack to upper leg. Foe spins to break free. He is disoriented badly. It takes a moment for him to see you.

A.text: Hinder foe’s weapon arm. Foe violently frees himself and takes a defensive stance.

B.text: Pull foe over, he breaks free. He is having trouble recovering. Your heart is broken.

C.text: Grab foe's waist. Your grip appeared to be strong, but now it is losing its advantage. Your foe is working free.

D.text: Painful grip on foe's hand. You do not break anything, but he thinks so. You have initiative for 4 rounds.

E.text: You and foe collide. He breaks your grip and stumbles away. You bounce back and miss a good opportunity.

A.text: You get in close and grab at foe's hair. He is daunted and steps back to escape your reach.

B.text: Grip to foe's garments. They rip and you lose a hopeful hold. Foe is carried back by his break-away.

C.text: Grapple foe's leg and try to lift it up off the ground. Foe slips away, but is off balance while recovering.

D.text: Catch foe's waist garments and pull him in. He is in trouble. He seeks to strike your hand and break your hold.

E.text: Grip to shield arm. Foe drops his shield as he wails in pain. You try to stay serious.

A.text: Foe spins away and comes back to face you. He is unbalanced.

B.text: Foe spins out of your grasp. However, spin nullifies his conterattack.

C.text: Short fingers render thigh hold ineffectual. Try lower next time.

D.text: Grip foe's side and shake him like a rattle. He is disoriented, but gets free.

E.text: Grasp around foe's leg proves effective. Foe is unbalanced for a moment.

A.text: Grip to arm gives foe a bruised bicep. Foe shakes free and prepares for your assault.

B.text: Slipping grasp around foe’s waist is weak. He breaks your grip and stumbles out of your way.

C.text: Grab foe around waist. Just when you think your grip is iron, he begins to break free. You might still prevail.

D.text: Clumsy bear hug around foe. Foe can do little to escape for the moment. Both his arms are pinned.

E.text: You find yourself on foe’s shield side. If he has a shield, you are stymied.

A.text: Strike foe’s weapon, disarming him. Foe fails to recover weapon. He has put himself in a bad spot.

B.text: You grab foe’s weapon arm and make him drop it with a violent shake. Foe strains wrist trying to break free.

C.text: Grab foe, he falls down and you follow. You knock him prone to stand back up. He is down for 1 round.

D.text: Grab leg and flip foe to ground, pinning him. Prone and immobile for 2 rounds, he might surrender.

E.text: Grasp foe around neck and bring him to ground. Muscles and tendons tear. Foe is prone and immobilized for 3 rounds.

A.text: Passing chest strike. Foe eludes grapple, keeps defensive stance.

B.text: Grip foe's neck. Push foe's chin back steadily. He should act soon, or...

metadata.DESC: -20 next round, -30 on round after that

C.text: Grab foe's shield arm. If foe has shield you grapple it. Until dropped: (-50)

D.text: Foe barely escapes immobilization, but must recover from the ordeal.

E.text: You almost disarm foe and trip him. He uses weapon arm to prevent his fall.

A.text: Grab an exposed garment. Uneasy grip impedes foe's actions.

B.text: Weak hold around foe's waist. He brings his knee up and you lose your grip. Foe does not recover quickly.

C.text: Very strong grip around foe's waist. Foe is held at a great disadvanatge. He might get free.

D.text: You grapple foe in a brutal way. Hold proves to be excellent. You have him. What next?

E.text: Foe evades your grasp by falling to the ground. A clever ploy. Smile at your good fortune.

A.text: Grapple foe's shield arm. If foe has a shield, you pull it down. If foe has no shield, you immobilize his arm.

B.text: Entangle foe's shield arm. If foe has shield, your grip makes it impossible to use. Until shield dropped: (-30) If no shield his arm is entangled.

C.text: Entangle foe's weapon arm. His weapon is held immobile. He cannot use it, but he will not drop it. He tries to knee you to escape, this fails.

D.text: Entangle foe's weapon arm. Foe hangs onto his weapon, but the arm is immobilized. You try to make him strike himself. It fails.

E.text: Grab foe's weapon arm and beat on it, without concern foe the rest of foe. Foe is disarmed. You tear ligaments and pull muscles.

A.text: Useful grip on foe's neck. Foe's face turns red. He cannot breath easily. Slowly he breaks your grip.

B.text: Grip around foe's waist unbalances him. You have the initiative. Foe shares much profanity with you.

C.text: Brutal grip around foe's chest, leaves bruises all over him. Your assault has created much confusion.

D.text: Grab knee and send foe down. He breaks his fall by breaking his shield arm. He is disarmed and prone.

E.text: Entangle both of foe's arms and pin them to his body. Foe cannot move his arms and he looks ready to surrender.

A.text: Grasp foe's leg, lifting it off the ground for a moment. You have the initiative for 6 rounds.

B.text: Entangle foe's leg and send him down. He does not hit hard. He pulls a muscle in his leg struggling.

C.text: Your assault is strong and lucky. As you grapple foe, you stomp his foot. He falls hard, breaking his shoulder.

D.text: Tie up both of foe's arms. He is immobile and cannot fight back effectively. You have him now.

E.text: Foe stumbles, with your assistance, and falls. His weapon breaks on impact. If foe has no chest armor, he takes a "D" Krush.

A.text: Entangle foe’s leg. Foe is knocked down. Foe lands on his weapon arm. He kicks and breaks free.

B.text: Pull foe’s legs together. He goes down, hitting hard and dropping his weapon. He feebly attempts to crawl for it.

C.text: Painfully immobilize weapon arm. Foe cannot surrender quickly enough to avoid the damage and pain.

D.text: Grapple foe’s legs and send him over. He hits his head in the fall. You get little resistance after that.

E.text: Wrap up foe’s legs. Foe tumbles to the ground like a ragdoll breaking both arms and an ankle. Foe is knocked out.

A.text: Ride foe down and immobilize him. He can do nothing for 12 rounds. You are prone also, while holding him down.

B.text: Entangle foe’s arm and flip him to ground, fracturing his leg. You immobilize him completely. He is prone, face down and still conscious.

C.text: Entangle foe's legs. Grapple weapon arm and break it on an available surface. You send foe to the ground. He falls very hard and is knocked out.

D.text: Crushing grip around foe's neck. If no neck armor, foe dies in 6 rounds from your mortal grip. Foe is disarmed.

E.text: Attack results in strangling hold. Foe flails legs in desperation. Foe is unable to break free and dies after 9 rounds of helpless struggling. Grim.

A.text: Foe’s legs are entangled long enough to make him fall. He is knocked out for 5 rounds.

B.text: Grip foe’s neck in a vicious hold. If foe cannot break your grip in 4 rounds, he will begin to pass out from suffocation.

C.text: Grip foe’s head and jerk it around. If foe has no neck armor, he dies.

D.text: Grapple foe's head. His skull is fractured during this assault. If he has no helm, he is in a coma for 30 days.

E.text: Crush foe's windpipe and pull the head from his body. You are mighty.
